statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Saint Mary's 72, Drake 66
article.story: MORAGA, Calif. (AP) -- Carlin Hughes scored 18 points and had five assists to lead Saint Mary's to a 72-66 victory over Drake in the final of the Saint Mary's Tip-off Classic on Saturday. Omar Samhan added 12 points, 10 rebounds and six blocked shots for the Gaels. Todd Golden added 12 points, all of which came on 3-point field goals, including a shot with :47 remaining that gave Saint Mary's a 68-63 lead. Saint Mary's is off to only its second 2-0 start in 12 seasons. They won their first two games of the 2004-05 season and finished with a 25-9 record that included a trip to the NCAA Tournament. Drake, which led by as many as eight early in the second half, was paced by Jonathan Cox, who scored 18 points and had nine rebounds. Josh Young added 16 points, while Leonard Houston scored 11. Saint Mary's had five players in double digits. Patrick Mills and Ian O'Leary scored 10 points apiece. The Gaels were 12 of 28 on 3-point field-goal attempts. Mills, who helped Australia qualify for the 2008 Olympics, played just 11 minutes in the first half as he picked up three fouls. His two free throws with :35 remaining extended the Gaels lead to 70-63. Drake shot 54 percent from the field in the first half to take a 38-35 lead after 12 lead changes. The Bulldogs fall to 1-1. Keno Davis was looking to become the first Drake coach to begin his career with a 2-0 record since Howard Stacey opened with back-to-back victories in 1971. Davis succeeded his father, Dr. Tom Davis, who retired after four seasons.
